cyclone.name: COLIN
cyclone.current_location: about 285 miles WSW of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Accelerating north-northeast today, then turning northeast across the Florida Big Bend and southeastern Georgia before emerging over the Atlantic and racing past the Carolina coast toward the open western Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (near or just south of Apalachicola/Cedar Key)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Sebastian Inlet FL to South Santee River SC (Atlantic side) – no watch on the Gulf side
weather_observation.warning_coast: Indian Pass to Englewood FL, including Tampa Bay; plus Sebastian Inlet FL to South Santee River SC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Gulf coast of west–central and north Florida, including Tampa Bay and Big Bend; later the southeastern U.S. Atlantic coast
weather_observation.wind: Sustained 35–45 kt (40–50 mph) with higher gusts possible Monday afternoon through late evening; strongest winds occur in squalls well south and east of the center.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–2 ft above ground level possible in Tampa Bay, locally up to 3 ft at surge-prone inlets; minor coastal flooding likely.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches likely with isolated totals up to 8 inches, producing ponding on terminal surfaces and possible freshwater flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain bands; dangerous surf and rip currents along local beaches could disrupt vessel traffic and port approach channels.
